body:
I've noticed some smaller guilds I follow will almost instantly have a single downvote on them for no apparent reason.  Downvoting something that is obnoxious or spam is all well and good; but if its the equivalent of posting ice cream in an ice cream guild and there's an instant downvote, its a little strange.

I have a guild where anything I post in it is almost instantly given a single downvote as well.  It happened almost immediately when I posted a song in +music too, and then later got several upvotes.

I don't know how widespread this is, but if a person or a bot does little but refresh "new" and downvote things, should there be something in place that prevents them from doing that?  For instance, the site notices you've done nothing but give x downvotes in x period of time and now you need to wait before you can downvote again.

Edit: I got an almost instant downvote for this one too.  Case in point.

Edit 2: Its a bot.  I just created +icecream, posted ice cream, refreshed the page and there was a downvote.
https://i.imgur.com/oHm9xvO.jpg

You're not alone in noticing these things and wanting change,  as I've been documenting this in +StopBrigades

I've been experiencing the issue now for some hours, and I've seen quite a few people on Ruqqus mention similar issues of posting then instantly getting downvoted. Has to be related.

post.body:
I've noticed some smaller guilds I follow will almost instantly have a single downvote on them for no apparent reason.  Downvoting something that is obnoxious or spam is all well and good; but if its the equivalent of posting ice cream in an ice cream guild and there's an instant downvote, its a little strange.

I have a guild where anything I post in it is almost instantly given a single downvote as well.  It happened almost immediately when I posted a song in +music too, and then later got several upvotes.

I don't know how widespread this is, but if a person or a bot does little but refresh "new" and downvote things, should there be something in place that prevents them from doing that?  For instance, the site notices you've done nothing but give x downvotes in x period of time and now you need to wait before you can downvote again.

Edit: I got an almost instant downvote for this one too.  Case in point.

Edit 2: Its a bot.  I just created +icecream, posted ice cream, refreshed the page and there was a downvote.
https://i.imgur.com/oHm9xvO.jpg

body: The instant downvote is either two things: 1. _All new posts_ go to +all where some people hangout and just downvote things 2. It's a temporary bug where posts start out at 0 instead of 1. Solution to #2 is simple, but #1 is debatable
body_html: The instant downvote is either two things: 1. All new posts go to +All where some people hangout and just downvote things 2. It's a temporary bug where posts start out at 0 instead of 1. Solution to #2 is simple, but #1 is debatable

body:
I don't know, I like the idea that the algorithm would only kick you into cooldown if you're incessantly downvoting.

If you're just participating and you upvote some stuff and downvote others, then it wouldn't kick you into cooldown just for downvoting someone who's repeatedly being stupid or toxic in a comment thread.

body: Should be for non-confirmed users. I think Reddit has a 10 minute post limit for new users. I always think of Wikipedia when this happens, since Wikipedia has a 4-day, 10 edit policy before you can edit gray-lock pages and a 30-day, 500-edit policy before you can edit blue-lock pages. There definitely should be an autoconfirmation system that works like that, where you can only downvote once every minute until you gain enough rep and have been on enough days. I'd say maybe 2 days, 25 rep... that isn't hard to do if you're a legitimate user and you lurk in the comments.
body_html: Should be for non-confirmed users. I think Reddit has a 10 minute post limit for new users. I always think of Wikipedia when this happens, since Wikipedia has a 4-day, 10 edit policy before you can edit gray-lock pages and a 30-day, 500-edit policy before you can edit blue-lock pages. There definitely should be an autoconfirmation system that works like that, where you can only downvote once every minute until you gain enough rep and have been on enough days. I'd say maybe 2 days, 25 rep... that isn't hard to do if you're a legitimate user and you lurk in the comments.

post.body:
I've noticed some smaller guilds I follow will almost instantly have a single downvote on them for no apparent reason.  Downvoting something that is obnoxious or spam is all well and good; but if its the equivalent of posting ice cream in an ice cream guild and there's an instant downvote, its a little strange.

I have a guild where anything I post in it is almost instantly given a single downvote as well.  It happened almost immediately when I posted a song in +music too, and then later got several upvotes.

I don't know how widespread this is, but if a person or a bot does little but refresh "new" and downvote things, should there be something in place that prevents them from doing that?  For instance, the site notices you've done nothing but give x downvotes in x period of time and now you need to wait before you can downvote again.

Edit: I got an almost instant downvote for this one too.  Case in point.

Edit 2: Its a bot.  I just created +icecream, posted ice cream, refreshed the page and there was a downvote.
https://i.imgur.com/oHm9xvO.jpg

That aside, wouldn't you also need a cooldown period for upvoting? People cant judge most posts either way without at least looking at them.

body: This is actually a software bug. Right now the default score shows 0 instead of 1 like it's supposed to. It's not actually downvoted. There really are downvote brigades, however those will show -1 or -2 currently, or will lose previous upvotes. Fortunately the devs are working on both fixing the voting bug and mitigating the downvote brigades.
body_html: This is actually a software bug. Right now the default score shows 0 instead of 1 like it's supposed to. It's not actually downvoted. There really are downvote brigades, however those will show -1 or -2 currently, or will lose previous upvotes. Fortunately the devs are working on both fixing the voting bug and mitigating the downvote brigades.
